segment.source: Description: Globalization is the process of designing and developing your app to act appropriately for different global markets without any changes or customization.
segment.target: Description: Globalization is the process of designing and developing your app to act appropriately for different global markets without any changes or customization.

segment.source: Search.SourceType: Video
segment.target: Search.SourceType: Video

segment.source: title: Globalization and localization
segment.target: title: Globalization and localization

segment.source: Globalization and localization
segment.target: Globalization and localization

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Windows is used worldwide, by audiences that vary in culture, region, and language.
segment.target: Windows is used worldwide, by audiences that vary in culture, region, and language.

segment.source: A user may speak any language, or even multiple languages.
segment.target: A user may speak any language, or even multiple languages.

segment.source: A user may be located anywhere in the world, and may speak any language in any location.
segment.target: A user may be located anywhere in the world, and may speak any language in any location.

segment.source: You can increase the potential market for your app by designing it to be readily adaptable using globalization and localization.
segment.target: You can increase the potential market for your app by designing it to be readily adaptable using globalization and localization.

segment.source: Globalization is the process of designing and developing your app to act appropriately for different global markets without any changes or customization.
segment.target: Globalization is the process of designing and developing your app to act appropriately for different global markets without any changes or customization.

segment.source: For example, you can:
segment.target: For example, you can:

segment.source: Design the layout of your app to accommodate the different text lengths and font sizes of other languages in labels and text strings.
segment.target: Design the layout of your app to accommodate the different text lengths and font sizes of other languages in labels and text strings.

segment.source: Retrieve text and culture-dependent images from resources that can be adapted to different local markets, instead of hard-coding them into your app's code or markup.
segment.target: Retrieve text and culture-dependent images from resources that can be adapted to different local markets, instead of hard-coding them into your app's code or markup.

segment.source: Use globalization APIs to display data that are formatted differently in different regions, such as numeric values, dates, times, and currencies.
segment.target: Use globalization APIs to display data that are formatted differently in different regions, such as numeric values, dates, times, and currencies.

segment.source: Localization is the process of adapting your app to meet the language, cultural, and political requirements of a specific local market.
segment.target: Localization is the process of adapting your app to meet the language, cultural, and political requirements of a specific local market.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: Translate the text and labels of the app for the new market, and create separate resources for its language.
segment.target: Translate the text and labels of the app for the new market, and create separate resources for its language.

segment.source: Modify any culture-dependent images as necessary, and place in separate resources.
segment.target: Modify any culture-dependent images as necessary, and place in separate resources.

segment.source: Watch this video for a brief introduction on how to prepare your app for the world: Introduction to globalization and localization.
segment.target: Watch this video for a brief introduction on how to prepare your app for the world: Introduction to globalization and localization.

segment.source: Articles
segment.target: Articles

segment.source: Article
segment.target: Article

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Do's and don'ts
segment.target: Do's and don'ts

segment.source: Follow these best practices when globalizing your apps for a wider audience and when localizing your apps for a specific market.
segment.target: Follow these best practices when globalizing your apps for a wider audience and when localizing your apps for a specific market.

segment.source: Use global-ready formats
segment.target: Use global-ready formats

segment.source: Develop a global-ready app by appropriately formatting dates, times, numbers, and currencies.
segment.target: Develop a global-ready app by appropriately formatting dates, times, numbers, and currencies.

segment.source: Manage language and region
segment.target: Manage language and region

segment.source: Control how Windows selects UI resources and formats the UI elements of the app, by using the various language and region settings provided by Windows.
segment.target: Control how Windows selects UI resources and formats the UI elements of the app, by using the various language and region settings provided by Windows.

segment.source: Use patterns to format dates and times
segment.target: Use patterns to format dates and times

segment.source: Use the Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting API with custom patterns to display dates and times in exactly the format you wish.
segment.target: Use the Windows.Globalization.DateTimeFormatting API with custom patterns to display dates and times in exactly the format you wish.

segment.source: Adjust layout and fonts, and support RTL
segment.target: Adjust layout and fonts, and support RTL

segment.source: Develop your app to support the layouts and fonts of multiple languages, including RTL (right-to-left) flow direction.
segment.target: Develop your app to support the layouts and fonts of multiple languages, including RTL (right-to-left) flow direction.

segment.source: Prepare your app for localization
segment.target: Prepare your app for localization

segment.source: Prepare your app for localization to other markets, languages, or regions.
segment.target: Prepare your app for localization to other markets, languages, or regions.

segment.source: Put UI strings into resources
segment.target: Put UI strings into resources

segment.source: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.
segment.target: Put string resources for your UI into resource files.

segment.source: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.
segment.target: You can then reference those strings from your code or markup.

segment.source: See also the documentation originally created for Windows 8.x, which still applies to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: See also the documentation originally created for Windows 8.x, which still applies to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
